00001 /* 
00002         jcom.envexp (previously names tl.envexp)
00003         create envelope with linear attack, exponential decay.  
00004         By Trond Lossius, Copyright © 2001-08
00005         Change History (most recent first):
00006 
00007                 06-Apr-2008:    <tl>    Moved to Jamoma, renamed jcom.envexp
00008                                                                 Upped to using 128 target-time pairs.
00009                                                                 Now use attributes
00010                                                                 Doxygen documented
00011                 17-Dec-2005:    <f.e.>  Ported to windows
00012                                                                 Note: float declarations MUST be changed to double
00013                                                                 Jeremy Bernstein adds:
00014                                                                 You'd probably do well to replace the shorts with longs, too,
00015                                                                 but it's not necessary.
00016                 29-Dec-2003:    <tl>    Compared code from <j> and <pc>.
00017                                                                 Integrated bug fixes by <pc> to <j> code
00018                 27-Dec-2003:    <j>             Carbonized once more
00019                 15-Feb-2003:    <pc>    Made Carbonizable
00020                                                                 This consisted mostly of updating some stuff
00021                                                                 for ANSI-C compatibility
00022 
00023                                                                 
00024         License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00025         http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html 
00026  */
00027 
00028 
00029 /*      Input:                                                                                                                                          */
00030 /*                      list:   Maximum amplitude, attack time, decay time                                      */
00031 /*                      bang:   Trigger new amplitude using stored values                                       */
00032 /*                      set:    Set envelope properties without triggering                                      */
00033 /*                      threshold (float):                                                                                                      */
00034 /*                                      Change low threshold value                                                                      */
00035 /*                      steal (int):                                                                                                            */
00036 /*                                      Enable/disable note stealing                                                            */
00037 /*                                                                                                                                                              */
00038 /*      Arguments:                                                                                                                                      */
00039 /*                      int:    Threshold amplitude. Envelope is terminated when this low       */
00040 /*                                      threshold is reached. Defaults to -90 dB.                                       */
00041 /*                      int:    Note stealing properties.                                                                       */
00042 /*                                              If 0: Note stealing disabled. When a envelope is                */
00043 /*                                                      triggered, a "0" is sent first so that amplitude        */
00044 /*                                                      immediately is set to 0.                                                        */
00045 /*                                              If non-zero: "0" is not sent. Hence the attack section  */
00046 /*                                                      of the envelope takes of from current amplitude         */
00047 /*                                                       value.                                                                                         */
00048 /*                                              Defaults to 1 (non-zero)                                                                */
00049 /*      Output:                                                                                                                                         */
00050 /*                      list:   Envelope in line~ format.                                                                       */
00051 /*                      int:    If note-stealing is disabled, the value "0" is transmitted      */
00052 /*                                      prior to list of envelope data.                                                         */
00053 /*                                                                                                                                                              */
00054 /* Trond Lossius 2000-06-26                                                                                                             */
00055 /********************************************************************************/
00056 
00057 #include "Jamoma.h"                                                                     // include Jamoma lib
00058 
00059 
00060 #define NUM_OF_POINTS 128                                                       
00061                 
00062 typedef struct _envExp {                                                        
00063         t_object        ob;                                                                     
00064         void            *obex;                                                          
00065         void            *outlet;                                                        
00066         Atom            envelope[NUM_OF_POINTS * 2];            
00067         float           attr_coeff;                                                     
00068         float           attr_amplitude;                                         
00069         float           attr_attack;                                            
00070         float           attr_decayrate;                                         
00071         float           attr_threshold;                                         
00072         long            attr_steal;                                                     
00073 }       t_envExp;
00074 
00075

00077 // Prototypes for methods: need a method for each incoming message
00078 
00080 void *envExp_new(Symbol *s, short argc, t_atom *argv);
00081 
00085 void envExp_bang(t_envExp *x);
00086 
00090 void envExp_float(t_envExp *x, double f);
00091 
00095 void envExp_assist(t_envExp *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00096 
00098 void envExp_setattack(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00099 
00101 void envExp_setamplitude(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00102 
00104 void envExp_setdecayrate(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00105 
00107 void envExp_setthreshold(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00108 
00110 void envExp_steal(t_envExp *x, long var);
00111 
00114 void envExp_calculate(t_envExp *x);

00118 // Globals
00119 t_class         *this_class;                            
00120 t_symbol        *ps_symbol;
00121 t_symbol        *ps_long;
00122 t_symbol        *ps_float32;
00123 t_symbol        *ps_dumpout;
00124 
00125 
00128 int main(void)
00129 {
00130         long attrflags = 0;
00131         t_class *c;
00132         t_object *attr;
00133 
00134         jamoma_init();
00135         ps_symbol = gensym("symbol");
00136         ps_long = gensym("long");
00137         ps_float32 = gensym("float32");
00138         ps_dumpout = gensym("dumpout");
00139 
00140         //setup(&this_class, (method)envExp_new, 0L, (short)sizeof(t_envExp), 0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00141         // Define our class
00142         c = class_new("jcom.envexp~",(method)envExp_new, 0L, (short)sizeof(t_envExp), 
00143                 (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00144         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_envExp, obex));
00145 
00146 
00147         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00148         class_addmethod(c, (method)envExp_bang,                         "bang",         A_CANT,         0);
00149         class_addmethod(c, (method)envExp_float,                        "float",        A_FLOAT,        0);
00150         class_addmethod(c, (method)envExp_assist,                       "assist",       A_CANT,         0); 
00151         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,         "dumpout",      A_CANT,         0);  
00152     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT,             0);
00153         
00154         // ATTRIBUTE: attack
00155         attr = attr_offset_new("attack", ps_float32, attrflags,
00156                 (method)0L, (method)envExp_setattack, calcoffset(t_envExp, attr_attack));
00157         class_addattr(c, attr);
00158 
00159         // ATTRIBUTE: maximum amplitude
00160         attr = attr_offset_new("amplitude", ps_float32, attrflags,
00161                 (method)0L, (method)envExp_setamplitude, calcoffset(t_envExp, attr_amplitude));
00162         class_addattr(c, attr);
00163                 
00164         // ATTRIBUTE: decay rate
00165         attr = attr_offset_new("decayrate", ps_float32, attrflags,
00166                 (method)0L, (method)envExp_setdecayrate, calcoffset(t_envExp, attr_decayrate));
00167         class_addattr(c, attr);
00168 
00169         // ATTRIBUTE: low threshold
00170         attr = attr_offset_new("threshold", ps_float32, attrflags,
00171                 (method)0L, (method)envExp_setthreshold, calcoffset(t_envExp, attr_threshold));
00172         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00173         
00174         // ATTRIBUTE: note stealing
00175         attr = attr_offset_new("steal", ps_long, attrflags,
00176                 (method)0L, (method)0L, calcoffset(t_envExp, attr_steal));
00177         class_addattr(c, attr);
00178 
00179         // Finalize our class
00180         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00181         this_class = c;
00182         return 0;
00183 }

00186 /************************************************************************************/
00187 #pragma mark -
00188 #pragma mark life cycle
00189 
00190 
00191 void *envExp_new(Symbol *s, short argc, t_atom *argv)
00192 {
00193         //create the new instance and returns a pointer to it
00194         t_envExp *x = (t_envExp *)object_alloc(this_class);
00195         
00196         if (x) {
00197                 // dumpout
00198                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));
00199                 // create outlet
00200                 x->outlet =outlet_new(x, 0L);
00201         
00202                 //Initialisation of attributes
00203                 x->attr_attack = 10;
00204                 x->attr_amplitude = 1.;
00205                 x->attr_decayrate = 90.;
00206                 x->attr_threshold = -90;
00207                 x->attr_steal = 1;
00208                 // handle attribute args
00209                 attr_args_process(x,argc,argv);
00210                 envExp_calculate(x);
00211         }
00212         return(x);                                              //must return a pointer to the new instance
00213 }

00216 /************************************************************************************/
00217 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00218 #pragma mark -
00219 #pragma mark methods
00220 
00221 
00222 void envExp_bang(t_envExp *x)
00223 {
00224         if (!x->attr_steal)
00225                 outlet_float(x->outlet, 0.);
00226         outlet_list(x->outlet, 0L, NUM_OF_POINTS * 2, x->envelope);
00227 }
00228 
00229 
00230 // Set peak amplitude and trigger output
00231 void envExp_float(t_envExp *x, double f)
00232 {
00233         x->attr_amplitude = f;
00234         envExp_calculate(x);
00235         envExp_bang(x);
00236 }
00237 
00238 
00239 // Set attack
00240 void envExp_setattack(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00241 {
00242         float f;
00243         
00244         if (argc)
00245         {
00246                 f = atom_getfloat(argv);
00247                 if (f>=0)
00248                         x->attr_attack = f;
00249                 envExp_calculate(x);
00250         }
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00254 // Set amplitude
00255 void envExp_setamplitude(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00256 {
00257         if (argc)
00258         {
00259                 x->attr_amplitude = atom_getfloat(argv);
00260                 envExp_calculate(x);
00261         }
00262 }
00263 
00264 
00265 // Set decay rate
00266 void envExp_setdecayrate(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00267 {
00268         float f;
00269         
00270         if (argc)
00271         {
00272                 f = atom_getfloat(argv);
00273                 if (f>0)
00274                 {
00275                         x->attr_decayrate = f;
00276                         envExp_calculate(x);
00277                 }
00278         }
00279 }
00280 
00281 
00282 //      Set threshold
00283 void envExp_setthreshold(t_envExp *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00284 {       
00285         float f;
00286         if (argc) {
00287                 f = atom_getfloat(argv);
00288                 if (f >= 0)
00289                         error ("jcom.envexp: Invalid threshold value");
00290                 else {
00291                         x->attr_threshold = f;
00292                         envExp_calculate(x);
00293                 }
00294         }
00295 }

00297 
00298 /*      Display assistance messages */
00299 void envExp_assist(t_envExp *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst) 
00300 {
00301         if (msg==1) { 
00302                 switch(arg){
00303                         case 0: sprintf(dst, "(List) Max. ampl, attack time, decay time");
00304                         break;
00305                 }
00306         }
00307         else if (msg==2) {
00308                 sprintf(dst, "Envelope data in line~ format");
00309         }
00310 }

00313 
00314 
00315 /************************************************************************************/
00316 // Internal methods used to calculate envelope
00317 #pragma mark -
00318 #pragma mark calculations
00319 
00320 
00321 void envExp_calculate(t_envExp *x)
00322 {
00323         long i, j;
00324         float timestep, k;
00325         
00326         // write delta time steps to array
00327         j = 1;
00328         atom_setfloat(&x->envelope[j], x->attr_attack);
00329         timestep = (-1000.*x->attr_threshold) /(x->attr_decayrate*(NUM_OF_POINTS - 2.));
00330         for (i=1; i<NUM_OF_POINTS; i++)
00331         {
00332                 j = j+2;
00333                 atom_setfloat(&x->envelope[j], timestep);
00334         }
00335         
00336         /*      write amplitude values to array */
00337         k = pow(10.,-0.05*x->attr_decayrate);
00338         for (i=0; i<(NUM_OF_POINTS-1); i++)
00339         {
00340                 j = 2*i;
00341                 atom_setfloat(&x->envelope[j], x->attr_amplitude*pow(k,i*timestep*0.001) );
00342         }
00343         j = (NUM_OF_POINTS-1)*2;
00344         atom_setfloat(&x->envelope[j], 0.);
00345 }
